name: Gatesinia

timeline_beats.label: Shipyard expansion & formalization of navigational auguries
Open-Seas Treaty; entry to wider maritime blocs
Joined Sea Trade Union; growing tariff harmonization
Succession Crisis and internal civil conflicts

factions.label: Maritime Merchants Guild
factions.influence_hint: dominant in port politics; controls trade licenses and customs

factions.label: Harbor House Aristocracy
factions.influence_hint: landed waterfront elites; seats in provincial councils

factions.label: Shipwrights & Augury Guild
factions.influence_hint: monopoly on large hull construction and sanctioned auguries

factions.label: Corsair Cantons
factions.influence_hint: informal privateers/private navies; disruptive coastal power

factions.label: Council of Clan-Governors
factions.influence_hint: rural hinterland chiefs; supply agricultural levies and militia

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries cannot replace charts or seamanship; they are regulated
Ritual magic requires scarce imported reagents or specialized labor; consumes supply
Combustion-derived industry limited; no high-pressure steam megatechs
State dependent on maritime reagent supply lines; vulnerable to blockades
notes: Recent succession crisis (W4) weakened central authority; guilds and clan-governors hold local power
Ports operate by merchant licenses; private warships and corsair activity are common
Charts and navigational lore treated as strategic assets; Shipwrights & Augury Guild tightly regulated
Reagent import routes are strategic chokepoints; control of Sinder Cay and Ironstrand Docks critical
Treaty (T1) and League (A1) membership constrain open-blockade policies but enforcement is uneven
